abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
An abstract class that defines the interface for macOS documents.
Adds the specified window controller to the current document.
Determines whether to close the document, prompting the user as needed to choose a course of action.
Creates the window controller objects that the document uses to display its content.
Removes the specified window controller from the receiverâ€™s array of window controllers.
Determines whether the system should close the document and its associated window.
Called after one of the documentâ€™s window controllers loads its nib file.
Called before one of the documentâ€™s window controllers loads its nib file.
The documentâ€™s current window controllers.
The name of the documentâ€™s sole nib file.
A window that an app displays on the screen.
Simulates the user clicking the close button by momentarily highlighting the button and then closing the window.
A controller that manages a window, usually a window stored in a nib file.
Tells the delegate that the user has attempted to close a window or the window has received a
message.
A true value.
Defines an opaque type that represents a method selector.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A raw pointer for accessing and manipulating untyped data.
